title: Phreaks Guide to Runes for season 5 2015

embed.description: Want to build out your rune pages for 2015 in League of Legends? We start out with the two must-have pages, and then go into some of the optimizations you can make as you acquire more runes and rune pages. -- Watch live at http://www.twitch.tv/phreakstream

body:
**ALL CREDIT TO PHREAK - i'm just putting this on the forums for new players and people who are interested in picking up some very useful info**

Making this thread for any new players or people who want an idea of what to buy with the upcoming sale.
The video is quite long, but very extensive and informative, youll learn a great deal of info.
**These are just general guide lines... You don't have to follow them. Experiment, try for yourself.**


This is the Cheat Sheet which can be used later or if you dont want to watch the whole thing, 
**NOTE: if your straped for IP or otherwise a beginner/new to league then the first 3 pages are very ideal.**

Quick Reference Guide

**Marks = RED
Seals = YELLOW
Glyphs = BLUE
Quints = PURPLE**

1. Standard AD Carry + Jungle Master Yi 
 x9 Attack Damage Marks - x9 Armor Seals - x9 Flat Magic Resist Glyphs - x3 Attack Speed Quints

2. Standard AD Champs (top lane & Jungle)	
x9 Attack Damage Marks - x9 Armor Seals - x9 Magic Resist Glyphs - x3 Attack Damage Quints

3. Standard AP
x9 Magic Pen Marks - x9 Armor Seals - x9 Magic Resist Glyphs - x3 Ability Power

4. Top lane AP tanks (Maokai, Singed)
x9 Magic Pen	Marks - x9 Scaling Armor - x9 Scaling Magic Resist Glyphs - x3 Abilty Power Quints

5. Top lane Dr. Mundo/Shyvana
x9 Hybrid Pen	Marks - x9 Scaling Armor - x9 Scaling Cooldown Reduction **OR**  x9 Scaling Magic Resist Glyphs - x3 Health Regeneration Quints

6. Top lane AD Scaling resists (Jarvan / etc,,)	
x9 Attack Damage Marks - x9 Scaling Armor - x9 Scaling Magic Resist Glyphs - x3 Attack Damage Quints

7. Jax & Irelia	
x9 Attack Damage Marks - x9 Scaling Armor - x9 Scaling Magic Resist Glyphs - x3 Attack Speed Quints

8. AD Assassins
x9 Armor Pen	Marks - x9 Scaling Armor **OR** Scaling Health Seals - x9 Scaling Cooldown Reduction - x3 Attack Damage Quints

9. AP Jungle Tanks (Amumu/Maokai)
x9 Attack Speed Marks - x9 Armor Seals - x9 Magic Resist **OR** x9 Scaling Magic Resist **OR** 3x Magic Resist and 6x Scaling Magic Resist **OR** x9 Scaling Cooldown Reduction Seals - x3 Ability Power or x3 Armor Quints

10. Jungle Tanks (Nautilus)
x9 Attack Speed Marks - x9 Armor Seals - x9 Scaling Cooldown Reduction **OR** x9 Magic Resist/Scaling MR Glyphs - x3 Armor Quints

11. AP Junglers (Fiddle, AP Amumu)
x9 Magic Pen	Marks - x9 Armor Seals - x9 Ability Power Glyphs - x3 Ability Power Quints

12. Jungle Lee Sin/Khaâ€™Zix
x9 Attack Damage Marks - x9 Armor Seals - x3 Magic Resist / x6 Cooldown Reduction Glyphs - x3 Attack Damage Quints

13. AP Mid vs AD
x9 Magic Pen	Marks - x9 Armor Seals - x9 Scaling Ability Power Glyphs- x3 Ability Power Quints

14. AP Mid vs Bursty AP
x9 Magic Pen	Marks - x9 Scaling Health or Armor Seals - x9 Magic Resist Glyphs - x3 Ability Power Quints

15. AP Greedy 
x9 Magic Pen	Marks - x9 Scaling Health - x9 Scaling Ability Power Glyphs - x3 Ability Power Quints

16. Yasuo 
x4 Armor Pen x5 Crit Chance Marks - x1 Crit Chance / x8 Scaling Armor Seals - x9 Scaling Magic Resist Glyphs - x3 AD or Life Steal Quints

17. AD Carry Greedy
x9 Attack Damage Marks - x9 Armor Seals - 3xMagic Resist / x6 Attack Speed Glyphs - x3 Attack Damage Quints

18. AD Carry Caster (Lucian, Graves)
x5 Armor pen x4 Attack Damage Marks - x9 Armor Seals - 3x Magic Resist / 6x Attack Speed Glyphs - x2 Attack Damage Quint / x1 Attack Speed Quints

19. Caster Support/AP Support 
x9 Magic Pen or Attack Damage Marks - x9 Flat Health Seals - x9 Ability Power Glyphs - x2 Armor / x1 Ability Power Quints

20. Tank Support (Thresh, Leona)
x9 Attack Damage Marks - x9 Flat Health Seals - x9 Magic Resist Glyphs - x3 Armor Quints

21. Greedy Support (Zyra, Brand)
x9 Magic Pen	Marks - x4 Armor / x5 Flat Health Seals - x9 Magic Pen Glyphs - x3 Magic Pen Quints


GOOD LUCK AND HAVE FUN ON THE FIELDS ON JUSTICE!

{{champion:104}}

replies.body: Man thats some good theory crafting.

its not theorycrafting tho....its basic set ups for standard results.

theory crafting would be seeing that a full AS page with 4 AR runes gives higher/faster clears of jungle as master yi.
something SPECIFIC.

just running basics on a large variety is just that, basics on a large variety. no theorycrafting went into it. atleast, no specificity.

the only example of specificity is yasuo. but whats the reasoning behind that one? 5 crit red and 1 crit yellow is 10% crit for him to achieve 100% crit full build before IE nerf? see, theres a bit of theory crafting to find out how much better 100% crit is than say 92%. (you cant just say 8% because of the traded stats in runes for the difference the 5 reds and 1 yellow crit makes compared to just 1 crit)

more specificity would be the old "ADCs running 1 or 2 mana regen blues or yellows" and how much that was worth.

overall, these pages are all the standardized pages from what? 2-3 years ago. with literally nothing changing. (oh wait, the HP seal value changes. but wait, here they are overvalued, because of the recent itemization changes in game to the champions he has the HP seals placed.)

see, standardized. not optimized. lacking theory-crafting. just personal opinion on standardized pages to optimize (yes there is some optimization here) IP COST EFFICIENCY FOR UPCOMING RUNE SALE!
thats all this is.

They are setups which were once thought out and number crunched "thoerycrafted" and came to be the optimal setups ideal for certain roles/situations. the time of which they were thought out does not negate the fact that they were theory crafted at one point or another.

the purpose of this thread was to take some useful information for new players to get a handle on rune setups and a general understanding of this particular part of the game, if they want to explore further by all means its highly encouraged!

We all had to start somewhere, learn from one source or another.

EDIT:
Also, if you believe there is a better rune page for a particular role, situation or champ.. then by all means make a thread about it, explain why you feel this way and provide data to back up that claim.. i welcome these types of threads, i'm sure others do too.  Its how we learn and progress. and hopefully evolve as a region

its just all in the wording. calling it some nice theorycrafting isnt true. its just basic sets.

like how some ADCs might prefer flat AD quints than the suggested AS ones. or MR per lvl vs non AP laners for later game efficiency in top or bot. or 1% crit to bolster early game with a lucky crit or some such.

theory crafting is in essence for getting the best possible result in a specific situation or point. its not just "hey these are the basics you can get and do fine" otherwise its theorycrafting to say "hurr durr full AP reds yellows blue and quints on any AP champ! so guud"

I think we could nit-pick and counter point all day, but i feel that wont achieve anything, so i ask. 

what is it you want? 

do you want the post removed? 
modified?
please clarify.
Ding dong
Husnhn
I want RP
i hope u dont maraud phreaks house in search for his freelo rune page formulas

I know right XD, Phreak also did some mastery pages to combo some of these runes, so i'll make another post today and link them together..


Should make for some fun and challenging games in season 5 :)
All Phreak needs is one page. His jungle page that does tons of damage!
One question: wouldn't it be better to have scaling health seals instead of flat health? At level 18, the HP would be higher.
I actually run AP vs AD by default, should I switch to AP greedy, is scaling health better than flat armour in general even in early game for champs like {{champion:101}}
Phreak, next time you hide your IGN next to your RP and IP, make sure you hide the one on you profile page too ;)

Hey there,

I actually have a legit question for Page 16/17. If x9 Magic Resist isn't worth it and you can substitute it for x3 Magic Resist, how is going for x3 worth it? Why not straight up go full x9 Attack Speed Glyphs or CDR or something else?
you can do that of course, just means magic damage will poke you for quite abit more damage. having x3 gives you 4MR which takes the edge off.
So btw, your ADC Greedy section is incorrect, (to the video) It's 3 AS quints, not AD quints.
So what category here does Katarina {{champion:55}} fall under?

AP Mid vs Bursty AP
x9 Magic Pen Marks - x9 Scaling Health or Armor Seals - x9 Magic Resist Glyphs - x3 Ability Power Quints

AP Greedy
x9 Magic Pen Marks - x9 Scaling Health - x9 Scaling Ability Power Glyphs - x3 Ability Power Quints
Nice!  {{champion:55}}
